context: (5a) and (5b) to estimate the dissolution (k d ) rate coefficient of the two VOCs. Fig. 6 shows plots of ln[( C max w − C w )/ C max w ] vs. time for both TCE and toluene dissolution into water, consistent with Eq. (5b). Results confirm that dissolution followed a first-order rate process. Values of the coefficient of determination (R 2) of the semi-log regressions obtained for TCE and toluene were in most or all cases equal to 0.98 or higher. The corresponding dissolution rate constants (k d ) are given in Table 2 . Results indicate that the dissolution rate constant (k d ) for TCE was slightly larger as compared to the value for toluene. The results in Fig. 6 were obtained using the approximate decoupled analytical solutions neglecting the effect of withdrawal of fluid due to sampling.
